['Providing guidance will be key as you support and direct both internal and external resources in the creation of the brand marketing from concept all the way to completion.
As a strong strategic thinker, you will play a vital role in brand analysis work– including tracking volume, retail data and competitive insights.
In marketing, meeting deadlines is of paramount importance. Your clear, cogent direction will facilitate managing, coordinating and orchestrating all the elements of the brand program, including each successive component of the marketing mix.
You will assist in the achievement and tracking of volume, profit and brand health goals.
', 'You have a Bachelor’s degree in marketing or business or, better yet, an MBA. Which leaves you perfectly poised to take the next step up into other commercial leadership roles.
You have at least 3 years of marketing experience for a Consumer Packaged Goods learning organization; add in sales experience and that could push you over the top.
Even with the title of “associate,” you operate with a general manager mindset, and always approach your work as an owner of the business.
You have an innate ability to build empathy with consumers, in particular millennials and diverse consumers.
Your stock answer to the status quo is “No,” plus you constantly challenge the expected to generate new ideas and find opportunities to improve.
“Tenacious” could be your middle name, but “resilient” and “always selling” would work too. You demonstrate conviction and know how to provide and defend a strong point of view.
', 'As the world’s family brewer, we have the scale to make big things happen and still get to know colleagues on a first name basis across the globe.
We play our part to make a difference – from charitable donations to hitting the streets together to build parks – giving back to the community is part of our culture and who we are.
As a beer enthusiast, you can become a Certified Beer Cicerone through in-house training that includes everything from brewing techniques to beer tasting and food pairings.
Participation in our Total Rewards program with a competitive base salary, incentive plans, parental leave, health, dental and pension benefits.
Work within a fast paced and innovative company, meeting passionate colleagues and partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences
']

Travel of up to 25% as needed']

Job Title: Assistant to Senior VP for External Affairs
Experience:
['
Responsible for a broad familiarity with the projects, activities, and programs reporting to the Senior VP and a thorough understanding of Art Institute administrative procedures
Think strategically and use outstanding organizational skills to plan for and accomplish key tasks and independent projects
Support the administration of External Affairs talent management;support mentorship and training programs; serve as a liaison with Human Resources, oversee onboarding processes and materials, plan and execute large and small staff meetings; develop and implement methods to share information about professional development resources and opportunities
Support the administration of External Affairs finances;manage quarterly tracking of program budgets and assist in the submission of annual budgets

Assist in addressing inquiries and requests from trustees, volunteers, staff members, and the general public
Create, assemble, or enhance departmental presentations with a variety of tools such as PowerPoint, InDesign, and others
Support departmental administration including organization and approval of departmental expenses, contracts, personnel actions, etc.
Manage the Senior VP office: order supplies, letterhead, publications, and special graphics/imaging products; create and process invoices

Ability to effectively communicate with a high degree of professionalism and confidence

Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and meet short deadlines
Ability to handle information with discretion and confidentiality
Ability to exercise judgment in prioritizing projects and handling situations', '
5+ weeks of paid time off
Paid holidays (up to 14 days)
Medical, dental, and vision insurance

Great employee discounts

['Providing guidance will be key as you support and direct both internal and external resources in the creation of the brand marketing from concept all the way to completion.
As a strong strategic thinker, you will play a vital role in brand analysis work– including tracking volume, retail data and competitive insights.
In marketing, meeting deadlines is of paramount importance. Your clear, cogent direction will facilitate managing, coordinating and orchestrating all the elements of the brand program, including each successive component of the marketing mix.
You will assist in the achievement and tracking of volume, profit and brand health goals.
', 'You have a Bachelor’s degree in marketing or business or, better yet, an MBA. Which leaves you perfectly poised to take the next step up into other commercial leadership roles.
You have at least 3 years of marketing experience for a Consumer Packaged Goods learning organization; add in sales experience and that could push you over the top.
Even with the title of “associate,” you operate with a general manager mindset, and always approach your work as an owner of the business.
You have an innate ability to build empathy with consumers, in particular millennials and diverse consumers.
Your stock answer to the status quo is “No,” plus you constantly challenge the expected to generate new ideas and find opportunities to improve.
“Tenacious” could be your middle name, but “resilient” and “always selling” would work too. You demonstrate conviction and know how to provide and defend a strong point of view.
', 'As the world’s family brewer, we have the scale to make big things happen and still get to know colleagues on a first name basis across the globe.
We play our part to make a difference – from charitable donations to hitting the streets together to build parks – giving back to the community is part of our culture and who we are.
As a beer enthusiast, you can become a Certified Beer Cicerone through in-house training that includes everything from brewing techniques to beer tasting and food pairings.
Participation in our Total Rewards program with a competitive base salary, incentive plans, parental leave, health, dental and pension benefits.
Work within a fast paced and innovative company, meeting passionate colleagues and partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences
']

Job Title: Public Relations Coordinator- Chicago, New York or Washington, DC
Experience:
["
Draft, edit, issue and pitch press releases on lateral hires, deal and case wins and Firm events; ensure timely, accurate and engaging storytelling, consistent with the Firm’s brand guidelines.
With the Senior Manager, develop strategic campaigns to advance the media relations goals of the Firm’s practices and sectors.
Serve as the primary point of contact for industry media inquiries, and actively assist lawyers and practices with the placement of articles and expert commentary in media outlets of all types, but primarily regional newspapers and business and trade publications.
In tandem with the Senior Manager, serve as the media coordinator for information and interviews; counsel spokespeople on messaging and interview preparation, as needed.
As part of a regional and global communications team, coordinate with colleagues to populate the Firm's intranet and external website with fresh, relevant content.
Contribute content to regional and global internal newsletters.
Refine best practices and processes to promote and provide messaging and media-related content to enhance the Firm's submissions to industry directories and regional, industry-specific or national awards.
Oversee daily media monitoring and archiving of the Firm’s news coverage.
Respond to media requests for photos, biographies and logos.
Conduct research on media lists, individual reporters, publications and other editorial opportunities.
Proactively identify and execute opportunities for lawyers to be featured as expert commentators and bylined authors by monitoring editorial calendars, developing relationships with reporters, monitoring current news events and other means as appropriate.
Fluency using media list services and tracking tools a plus.", '
Bachelor’s degree in journalism, communications, English or marketing.
Minimum of 2 to 3 years of combined experience in a law firm, public relations agency, corporation and/or professional services firm desired; law firm experience preferred.
Demonstrated professional poise and confidence in gathering information on Firm initiatives, asking the right questions, and guiding and advising lawyers and business development colleagues on PR strategies.
Ability to identify and monitor trends in the legal industry and translate those into viable public relations opportunities.
Team-oriented and collaborative approach to work; strong relationship-building skills and experience working across multiple time zones is a plus.
Superior writing skills, working knowledge of AP style and experience writing and editing press releases, announcements and similar materials.
Demonstrated ability to manage sensitive and confidential information,.
Outstanding ethics, integrity and discretion are a must.
Excellent organizational and communications skills, with ability to think, react and communicate quickly.
Experience in and working knowledge of the press, print, broadcast and digital media.
Existing media relationships a plus.
Solid news and business judgment, professional demeanor and confidence.
Intellectual curiosity and good humor are major pluses.
Strong attention to detail, with ability to prioritize (and re-prioritize) to meet deadlines.']

['Work with various CIBC US business groups to provide communication support including planning, writing and proofreading for internal messages, press releases, white papers, presentations, etc.
Help drive awareness, understanding and engagement of US employees leveraging strong communication planning and execution.
Collaborate with communication colleagues across North America as needed to ensure effective message development and delivery.
Support delivery of communications using all appropriate channels such as email, Workplace, intranet, social media, website, etc.
Develop and maintain key relationships among team members and business partners.', "3 to 5 years of corporate communications, PR and/or marketing communications experience
Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, business or other relevant area of study required
Willingness to jump in and help out on projects across the team as needed.
Extremely strong writing, editing and proofing skills
Highly organized, detail oriented, forward-thinking with the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
Aggressive self-starter, ability to work both independently and collaboratively."]
